Package pieces

Class ChessPiece

java.lang.Object
pieces.ChessPiece
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class ChessPiece extends Object
Represents a general Chess Piece

    • canMoveTo

      public boolean canMoveTo​(Board.Cell dest)
      Checks if a given destination cell is within this piece's valid moves.
      Parameters:
      dest - of this chess piece
      Returns:
      whether or not this piece can move to dest

    • searchPath

      void searchPath​(Board board, int i, int j)
      Searches a straight-line path of cells in a given direction until a cell is occupied by another piece or the end of the board is hit. If an occupied cell can be overtaken by this piece, then that cell will mark the end of the path; otherwise, the previous cell marks the end. All cells from the start and end of this path will be added to this piece's valid moves.

      Additionally, if the enemy King is found within a path, all cells from this piece's position to the enemy King's position will be added in pathToKing. The cell after the King, if empty, will also be added in pathToKing to anticipate the King's next moves to determine possible checkmate.

      Example: an i value of 0 and j value of -1 would mean to search the columns to the left of this chess piece in the same row.

      Parameters:
      board - that this chess piece is on
      i - offset to the row this chess piece is in. -1 = up; 0 = same; 1 = down
      j - offset to the column this chess piece is in. -1 = left; 0 = same; 1 = right

    • searchStep

      void searchStep​(Board board, int i, int j)
      Searches a single cell in a given direction. If it is empty or can be overtaken, it is marked as a valid move. If the piece that can be overtaken is the enemy King, then add that cell in pathToKing.
      Parameters:
      board - that this chess piece is on
      i - offset to the row this chess piece is in. -i = up i; i = down i
      j - offset to the column this chess piece is in. -j = left j; j = right j

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition​(Board.Cell cell)
      Sets the position of this piece to a given cell.

      public void decrementNumMoves()

      This is done in the case of having to undo a move.
